fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64913].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, top search bar in JIRA server do not provide suggestion as how it was in JIRA Cloud

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide same functionality as available in JIRA Cloud for top search Bar. Below is an example for current search in JIRA cloud and JIRA Server.

*JIRA Cloud*:
 !cloud search.png|thumbnail! 

*JIRA Server*:
 !jira server.PNG|thumbnail! 
h3. Why this is important
As many users are using JIRA it is not possible for them to remember the exact word for each of their search hence a suggestion while they are tying the words would be very helpful for the customer. 
 
h3. Workaround 
The search Bar still works but it do not provide a search suggestion or Layout as shown in JIRA Cloud
fields.summary: Provide Same Top Search Bar Suggestion As JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64912].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA does not provide an option to edit the E-mail templates via GUI, and the only way to edit the templates is by navigating to {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/}} of the <jira-application-dir> in your JIRA installation directory and manually editing those files. In addition, this form of customization is also unsupported as per the [Atlassian Support Offerings |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Support/Atlassian+Support+Offerings].

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the users with the ability to edit those files through the GUI or provide an alternative simpler method.  

h3. Workaround
Users may refer to [Customizing email content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/customizing-email-content-802592932.html] KB for more information on how to perform this manually
fields.summary: Provide the user with the ability to edit e-mail templates via GUI
Add Created Date to Filters
Allow JIRA Administrators to view and bulk remove unused schemas
Developer's gadget documentation missing example xml files
As a JIRA admin I would like JIM to support a Mingle importer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64906].
  {panel}

Please provide an option how to link existing image attachment (thumbnail or link) when using the editor button 'Attachments'.

Current situation:
 - Attachments are enabled
 - Thumbnail support is enabled.
 - A ticket has one or more image attachments.

As a user I want to link the image attachment in a comment as a clickable link, not as thumbnail.
 Example
{noformat}
[^image.png]
instead of
!image.png!
{noformat}
Currently, if the user clicks the Attachments button (in the editor and then on the desired image attachment, the wiki syntax for displaying the image as a thumbnail is being generated. However, I want to get the syntax for the clickable link.

In our current JIRA version 7.0.10 there is no setting to adjust that behaviour globally on a per project basis. Also I could not find any open issues or answers regarding this topic.
fields.summary: Provide an option how to link an image attachment in the description/comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64901].
  {panel}

h3. Summary  
When ever you are bulk edit issues and you have a text value in the change comment field. When you try to select the checkbox it immediately gets unchecked. However if you select it again it stays selected. 

h3. Environment
  
Happens in all browsers. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 

# Perform a search in basic/advanced.
# Click Tools then Bulk Edit. 
# Select issues and the "Edit issues" option. 
# Drop down to change comment and text in the text field.
# Select change comment my clicking on it once. 

h3. Expected Results  
The change comment check box would stay checked on the first click. 

h3. Actual Results  
It triggers a check but then immediately is unchecked. 
[^1click_converted.mp4]

 h3.Workaround 
Click the box again and it will stay checked.
fields.summary: On Bulk Edit "Edit Issues" Change comment checkbox gets un-toggled if text filed has value.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64900].
  {panel}

Due to the way JIRA commit to index on every index operation, we start seeing large instances that Lucene write operations (e.g create/edit issue) are slow waiting for QueueingIndex implementation (waiting for the writer thread to complete other running process one by one)

* Lets say we have ~_100_ issues in a queue (expected for instance with many creates/updated/deletes)
* Let's say each Lucene commit takes _10 ms_
* Then 100 issues are forced to wait ~1s ( 100 issues * 10 ms), and if they are not lucky, then they have to wait for a previous batch to be finished first (total time spent in  a queue:  1-2s)

In some cases the create issue can be as slow as 19s with the following breakdown
{quote}
23:21:54 - action not started.
23:21:56 - reindexing issue after issue created/transitioned. || Indexing thread waiting for merging thread
23:21:58 - reindexing issue after issue created/transitioned || Indexing thread is working
23:22:01 - reindexing issue after issue Created event. || Indexing thread is working
23:22:04 - Service desk setStringPropertyToIssue and reindex issue || Indexing thread is working
23:22:06 - Service desk updates SLA value, and reindex issue. Waiting for reindexing to be finished. || Index thread is working
23:22:08 - Service desk updates SLA value, and reindex issue. Waiting for reindexing to be finished. || Index thread is working
23:22:11 - processing webhooks - reading from the index
23:22:13 - processing webhooks - reading from the index
23:22:15 - processing webhooks - reading from the index
23:22:16 - End of issue create action
{quote}

Summary:
* issue create took ~19 seconds
* 4x reindexed the issue ( ~14 seconds)
* processing webhook (~ 5 seconds)

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.7
* 1.5M issues + 2k custom fields + 2.5M comments and 396 projects
* ServiceDesk with (100) automation rule

h3. Verification

* Create/edit issue is slow (eg. 20s)
* Large number of threads waiting for re-index
{code:java}
grep -B 3 -A 10 'java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch' threads/jira_threads.1489620113.txt  | awk '/http-nio-8080/{print $1}' | sort -u | wc -l
     150 
{code}
** Example of the thread waiting for reindex:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"http-nio-8080-exec-374 uri:/secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa username:admin" #8603445 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f24b40d5800 nid=0x2f47 waiting on condition [0x00007f2346ff0000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000645800218> (a java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch$Sync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.parkNanos(LockSupport.java:215)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.doAcquireSharedNanos(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1037)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.tryAcquireSharedNanos(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1328)
	at java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch.await(CountDownLatch.java:277)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.SettableFuture.get(SettableFuture.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.FutureResult.await(FutureResult.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder$CompositeResult.await(AccumulatingResultBuilder.java:175)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager$$Lambda$2043/398130608.await(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.obtain(DefaultIndexManager.java:815)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.await(DefaultIndexManager.java:791)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:571)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssueObjects(DefaultIndexManager.java:468)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndex(DefaultIndexManager.java:489)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndex(DefaultIndexManager.java:473)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1800.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:22)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy16.reIndex(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IssueIndexManager$reIndex.call(Unknown Source)
{code}
* Issue reindex done in batches by *ISSUE-indexQueue:thread-1*
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"ISSUE-indexQueue:thread-1" #431 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f22341ea000 nid=0x4f28 runnable [0x00007f18748f9000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.lang.String.intern(Native Method)
	at org.apache.lucene.util.SimpleStringInterner.intern(SimpleStringInterner.java:77)
	at org.apache.lucene.util.StringHelper.intern(StringHelper.java:39)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.FieldInfos.read(FieldInfos.java:362)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.FieldInfos.<init>(FieldInfos.java:71)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentCoreReaders.<init>(SegmentCoreReaders.java:72)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.get(SegmentReader.java:114)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:702)
	- locked <0x00000001d5ef7018> (a org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:677)
	- locked <0x00000001d5ef7018> (a org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.BufferedDeletesStream.applyDeletes(BufferedDeletesStream.java:249)
	- locked <0x000000021a1b79b8> (a org.apache.lucene.index.BufferedDeletesStream)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.doFlush(IndexWriter.java:3571)
	- locked <0x00000001e1bd7430> (a org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.flush(IndexWriter.java:3508)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.prepareCommit(IndexWriter.java:3371)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commitInternal(IndexWriter.java:3444)
	- locked <0x00000001deb47cf0> (a java.lang.Object)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3426)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3410)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.WriterWrapper.commit(WriterWrapper.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$WriterReference.commit(DefaultIndexEngine.java:239)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$FlushPolicy$2.commit(DefaultIndexEngine.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$FlushPolicy.perform(DefaultIndexEngine.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine.write(DefaultIndexEngine.java:184)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndex.perform(DefaultIndex.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.perform(QueueingIndex.java:132)
	- locked <0x00000001d5ef7048> (a com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.index(QueueingIndex.java:144)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.run(QueueingIndex.java:111)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Issue creation should be fast

h3. Actual Results
Issue creation is as slow as 20s with many thread waiting on QueueingIndex

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Commit issue in batches instead of individual operation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64898].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition 
Currently its all or nothing the user must have the following three criteria to @mention. 

# Browse users permission. 
# Wiki Style render enabled
# As well as mail visibility. [See user mail visibility|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Configuring+JIRA+application+options]

h3. Suggested Solution  

It would be nice to make it scalable that as long as Wiki Style Render and mail visiblity applies to the user attempting to at mention via [^usera]. The function would work without browse users. 

h3. Why this is important   
It allows users to enable users to @mention without having them be able to browse users in the entire instance.
fields.summary: Allow [^username] to send notification to user even if the input user doesn't have browse user permission.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64892].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If the attachment file name is too large, when selecting the attachment to add in the comment, the full name of the file isn't displayed.
 !Attachment name.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Show the full name of the file directly, or when performing a mouse hover.

h3. Why this is important
It will make easier to add the correct attachment as it will be able to see the name directly in the comment tab, instead of having go to the issue's attachment and check the full name of the desired attachment.
fields.summary: Display all file name when commenting an attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64888].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As per the official documentation [Linking issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver073/linking-issues-861257339.html] and the KB article [How does the searching during Issue Linking works|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-does-the-searching-during-issue-linking-works-712641539.html], when you link an issue via the *Link* dialog box there will be both the *History Search* and *Current Search*.

 !image-2017-03-21-19-22-12-288.png|thumbnail! 

In the *Link* dialog, there is also an option to *search for an issue* that will allow you to search for any issues easily.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

However, if you add the *Linked Issues* field to the issue's screen. When creating or editing the screen, only the *History Search* is displayed and not the *Current Search* and *search for an issue* option.

 !image-2017-03-21-19-25-12-713.png|thumbnail! 

 !image-2017-03-21-19-25-49-384.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the "*Linked issues*" field to have the *Current Search* option as well as the *search for an issue* option.

h3. Why this is important

Users will be able to conveniently link issues upon issue creation/edit without memorizing the exact issue key of the linked issues.
 
h3. Workaround 

Select *More* > *Link* and use the Link issues dialog to link your issues.
fields.summary: The "Linked Issues" field in the issue screen should function the same as linking an issue via More > Link.

 at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:98)
 at com.querydsl.sql.dml.SQLInsertClause.executeWithKeys(SQLInsertClause.java:335)
 ... 294 more
 \{noformat}
h3. Notes

JIRA Seems to be default check for the public."AO_B9A0F0_APPLIED_TEMPLATE" table, it will not find this.
h3. Workaround

You can set the default search_path at the database level:

{{ALTER DATABASE <database_name> SET search_path TO schema1,schema2;}}

Or at the user or role level:

{{ALTER ROLE <role_name> SET search_path TO schema1,schema2;}}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64883].
  {panel}

We use email as a method for adding comments to JIRA issues.  This is an excellent method for tracking issue history, especially in "business" projects that are big on communications.  User can send emails and CC a JIRA email address to add it to a comment. Sweet. Regular users have an embedded code in their signatures and we use the "Add a comment before a specified marker" handler to truncate the user signature and message history from the saved JIRA comment.

This generally works well but it a problem with some users eg external consultants and occasional users who don't who don't use the truncation code.  An email may have one or often several images plugged into their signature, like a company logo, a facebook logo, a think-before-printing message, etc.  With an email history, they may be adding a bunch of both their and others logos in one easy/nasty hit.

In these cases, a large number of attachments can build up via an email exchange making the "real" issue content hard to see.  *These are a ***** grind to delete*.  To delete, the user must click the _bin_ icon, then wait for the confirmation screen, then click ok.  That's not a problem one-off but extremely slow and frustrating for deleting 20 attachments.

Solution 1: (quick) Allow attachments to be checked and bulk deleted on the attachments page.

Solution 2 (much better!) : Use a hash to detect duplicate attachments and only display the latest on the main issue page.  Duplicates are displayed in the attachments window and a single "Delete duplicates" button click kills all but the most recent version.

Solution 3 (even better!)  In addition to detecting and displaying only the latest attachment as above, allow attachments to be marked as junk.

Once marked as junk:
 # They are not displayed on the main issue page at all, significantly reducing clutter. :)
 # Only a single copy is kept, and this is shown in a new "junk" section/link on the attachments page.  (Marked: "These attachments are never displayed or retained")
 # It should be possible to unjunk an attachment to allow it to be displayed from then on.

_To work really nicely, the junk attachments list would be be global across the project._  If this is an issue, maybe a switch could control it?  (Allowing junk declarations across the whole instance would be quite spiffy for those pesky facebook icons but might be considered a bit of a bit of a risk and generate an authorisation problem...)

Automatic removals could be logged for audit purposes if this doesn't clutter the activity log.  And the _don't delete anything that is not in the junk library_ rule means that there is always a copy available if it is actually required.
fields.summary: Attachment Hell with emailed comments
Allow setting the default restriction for work log entries

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64878].
  {panel}

From time to time, JIRA's {{nodeassociation}} table has abandoned references between schemes and projects. This is suspected to occur if a project was deleted, but for some reason these references remain.

The integrity checker should help detect when a non-valid project ID is referenced in {{nodeassociation}} and remove the reference.

As of JIRA 7.x, for example, if there is a reference to a non-existent project, the UI will result in an error and prevent admins from modifying the schemes. The logs show:
{code}
2017-03-10 14:51:25,249 http-nio-8080-exec-46 uri:/jira/secure/admin/views/permissions/viewschemes.jsp username: admin ERROR admin 891x118804x1 1ya7wma 10.102.167.67,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/ViewPermissionSchemes.jspa [webwork.util.ValueStack] METHOD: "projects", exception: 
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.util.Comparator.lambda$comparing$77a9974f$1(Comparator.java:469)
	at java.util.TimSort.binarySort(TimSort.java:296)
	at java.util.TimSort.sort(TimSort.java:239)
	at java.util.Arrays.sort(Arrays.java:1512)
	at java.util.stream.SortedOps$SizedRefSortingSink.end(SortedOps.java:348)
	at java.util.stream.Sink$ChainedReference.end(Sink.java:258)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:482)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499)
	at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.AbstractSchemeManager.getProjects(AbstractSchemeManager.java:481)
	at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.AbstractViewSchemes.getProjects(AbstractViewSchemes.java:13)
	... 2 filtered
	...
{code}

A method to look for these bad references is via SQL:
* For example, when looking for a permission scheme that refers to be non-existent project:
{code}
select * from nodeassociation where sink_node_entity = 'PermissionScheme' and sink_node_id = 0 and source_node_id not in (select id from project);
{code}
* This will return references that have an invalid project ID
* This row should then be removed
fields.summary: Integrity Checker Should Check and Fix Invalid Scheme References to Removed Projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64857].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Index snapshots are not based on the server timezone, but based on the configured "Default user time zone".

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to: JIRA Admin > System > General Configuration 
# Modify the "Default user time zone" to be different than the "System default"
** In my test, system default is GMT +11, I'll be changing it to be GMT -6
# Enable Index Snapshots and set a time
** Notice that the server time is presented, which is *not* the "Default user time zone":
!index-snapshot-setting.png|thumbnail!
** In this case, we set it to 11:00am server time, which is GMT +11
# Wait until an index snapshot is run
# Notice that it does not run during the specified time, which the UI indicates.
# Realize later that the snapshot is taken during 11:00am GMT -6
{code}
[server]...-home/export/indexsnapshots❯ ll
total 8336
drwxrwxr-x 2 dos dos    4096 Mar 18 03:09 ./
drwxrwxr-x 4 dos dos    4096 Mar 18 02:39 ../
-rw-rw-r-- 1 dos dos 8525140 Mar 18 03:00 IndexSnapshot_2017-Mar-18--0300.zip

[server]...-home/export/indexsnapshots❯ timedatectl
      Local time: Sat 2017-03-18 03:21:47 AEDT
  Universal time: Fri 2017-03-17 16:21:47 UTC
        Timezone: Australia/Sydney (AEDT, +1100)
{code}

h4. Expected Behaviour
* The index configurations showed server time using GMT +11
* It's expected that the snapshot is created during the specified 11:00am GMT +11

h4. Actual Behaviour
* Index snapshot is taken at 3:00am GMT +11
* Snapshot did not use the specified server time, but instead used "Default user time zone"
fields.summary: Index Snapshot Scheduler is Using Incorrect TimeZone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64848].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

# We suspect stems from JIRA not handling Microsoft Office attempting to ascertain whether it can edit the file directly via WebDAV, and stripping URL-encoded spaces too early, which can be seen from the fact that Nginx says that it requests the URL with URL-encoded spaces
# In Hercules on 7.2.2. , there are 4 hits for 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/nullpointerexception-when-authenticating-from-ie-216959513.html?utm_medium=logScan&utm_source=STP 
# From the JIRA log, we see: 
{code}
2017-03-07 08:15:30,382 http-nio-8180-exec-24 ERROR anonymous 495x111348x1 - 172.21.239.251,10.50.214.119 /secure/attachment/11203/Adgang%20til%20VP%20Centralen.docx [c.a.j.web.servlet.ViewAttachmentServlet] Error serving file for path /11203/Adgang til VP Centralen.docx: Illegal character in path at index 31: /secure/attachment/11203/Adgang til VP Centralen.docx
{code}
...with Nginx in front of it, on another machine, says
{code}
[07/Mar/2017:08:15:30 +0100] "HEAD /secure/attachment/11203/Adgang%20til%20VP%20Centralen.docx HTTP/1.1" 500 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Existence Discovery"
{code}
# It would seem, that JIRA (+Nginx?) is having trouble with Microsoft Office attempting to ascertain whether it can save directly to the file.
# Entering the attachment URL directly in Firefox serves the file with no problem and nothing in the JIRA log.
# From the Nginx access log :
{code:borderStyle=solid}
172.21.239.251 - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:54 +0100] "GET /secure/attachment/11425/Oprettelse%20af%20Frederik%20Jensen.xlsx HTTP/1.1" 200 12041 "https://jnjiraportal.sif.jndata.net/browse/JB-119" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/7.0; rv:11.0) like Gecko"
172.21.239.251 - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:55 +0100] "OPTIONS /secure/attachment/11425/ HTTP/1.1" 200 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Protocol Discovery"
172.21.239.251 - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:55 +0100] "OPTIONS /secure/attachment/11425/ HTTP/1.1" 200 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Excel 2013 (15.0.4805) Windows NT 6.1"
172.21.239.251 - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:56 +0100] "HEAD /secure/attachment/11425/Oprettelse%20af%20Frederik%20Jensen.xlsx HTTP/1.1" 500 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Excel 2013 (15.0.4885) Windows NT 6.1"
172.21.239.251 - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:56 +0100] "OPTIONS /secure/attachment/ HTTP/1.1" 200 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Excel 2013 (15.0.4805) Windows NT 6.1"
172.21.239.251 - - [15/Mar/2017:15:50:56 +0100] "HEAD /secure/attachment/11425/Oprettelse%20af%20Frederik%20Jensen.xlsx HTTP/1.1" 500 0 "-" "Microsoft Office Existence Discovery"

Take note of the user agent "Microsoft Office Protocol Discovery" - it would seem the Office application attempts to ascertain whether it can edit the document directly via WebDAV or some-such - the 500 is coming from JIRA, which seems to, somehow, strip the URL encoding of the path a bit too early (or Nginx does it), since JIRA complains about spaces in the URL, as per:

2017-03-15 15:50:56,305 http-nio-8180-exec-12 ERROR anonymous 950x555726x1 - 172.21.239.251,10.50.214.119 /secure/attachment/11425/Oprettelse%20af%20Frederik%20Jensen.xlsx [c.a.j.web.servlet.ViewAttachmentServlet] Error serving file for path /11425/Oprettelse af Frederik Jensen.xlsx: Illegal character in path at index 35: /secure/attachment/11425/Oprettelse af Frederik Jensen.xlsxjava.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal character in path at index 35: /secure/attachment/11425/Oprettelse af Frederik Jensen.xlsx
{code}


h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.2
* Nginx
fields.summary: False positive in Hercules log scanner for Microsoft Office files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64845].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The lucene index files location health check fails for BTRFS and probably other sub-volume file system mounts.
h3. Environment
 * Linux server
 * BTRFS sub-volume mounted

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Mount a BTRFS sub-volume
 # Configure JIRA to store index files on BTRFS volume mount
 # Run health check

h3. Expected Results

Health check is able to resolve the volume and validate conditions are met to pass the check, or fails based on conditions.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown displayed in the health check:
{noformat}
Exception during check invocation: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Mount point not found
{noformat}
h3. Notes

It looks like there is an issue with Java and sub-volume mounts in linux which BTRFS supports. Here's an open issue describing the problem for OpenJDK:
 * [JDK-8165852 - (fs) Mount point not found for a file which is present in overlayfs - Java Bug System|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8165852]

While OpenJDK is not supported by Atlassian, it appears that the Oracle Java impelmentation has the same issue as noted in this thread by Elasticsearch users seeing the same issue with BTRFS:
 * [unable to start elasticsearch on btrfs subvolume · Issue #14337 · elastic/elasticsearch · GitHub|https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/14337]

The call that throws the exception is:
{code:java}
Files.getFileStore()
{code}
h3. Workaround

Move the JIRA home directory to a non sub-volume mounted file system.

There is also a BTRFS specific workaround mentioned in the Elasticsearch issue, but it is specific to their configuration and linux version.
fields.summary: Lucene index file location health check fails with java.io.IOException: Mount point not found
Include Components in Release Notes

h3. Summary

Emails from JIRA platform are being rejected because the JIRA sending mail server has been blacklisted. Such SPAM blocklists include:
 * [SORBS|http://www.sorbs.net/]

Ask your email/security administrator to track incoming emails from JIRA. If affected, your mail filtering/service logs will confirm that emails from JIRA are being rejected for reasons related to blacklisting.

Example: 

!Rejection_Properties.png!

The way this information is displayed varies, but the log description should read similar to "IP Found in RBL".
h3. Environment

JIRA Infrastructure
h3. Expected Results

Emails are successfully delivered to the recipient.
h3. Actual Results

Emails are rejected by recipient server because the JIRA mail server was blacklisted.
 
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround. Contact support for information regarding your specific issue.

{noformat}
java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No enum constant com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api.DirectoryType.IDP

	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.forward(DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.java:55) [?:?]

h3. Summary
I don't have too much information on this, however I am raising this in the event that it assists someone in the future regarding a similar problem.

The issue that was reported was that:  *importing from Redmine 2.6.1* with Microsoft SQL Server seemed to fail due to the use of {{smallint}} data type in the {{issue_statuses}} table.

Microsoft SQL Server

h3. Actual Results

h3. Summary
It is currently not possible to choose whether to include or exclude users during imports from FogBugz On Demand in JIRA Cloud. As per the documentation on external import, this is a feature that is included:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-fogbugz-on-demand-776636741.html

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud {{7.2.0-OD-05-030}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to _External System Import_: https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ExternalImport1.jspa
# Click on FogBugz On Demand
# The import wizard will be displayed. Key in FogBugz On Demand URL and credentials. Click _Next_.
# Select projects to  be included. Click _Next_.
# Select fields to be mapped. Click _Next_.
# Select values to be mapped. Click _Next_.
# Select links to be mapped. Click _Next_.


h3. Expected Results
One of the steps of the wizard to have an option to choose to import users or not.

h3. Actual Results
No option to include users during any of the stages. Please refer to the screen shots for each of the step.
 
h3. Notes
The importer is currently including users by default.

h3.Workaround
None at the moment.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64818].
  {panel}

Index may cause issue during [CSV import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer]. It happens when there is project with single issue type only and there is required custom field with Context set to that project. During manual creation is everything OK.

*Replication*
# Create new JIRA project, with exactly one issue type.
# Add new custom field. And restrict context for that issue type.
# In project Issue Field Configuration scheme set all fields to optional, except Sumary (It is mandatory to have it mandatory) and the new custom field.
# Create issue normally - it works
# Create issue by CSV import - Import fails because that field is always treated as null.

*Note:* Because there is only single issue type, import wizard do not offer Issue Type for mapping. My theory is that importer checks context before it actually applies issue type - automatically.

*Workaround:* Set context into project instead of Issue type.
fields.summary: CSV Import for restricted custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64817].

I ran up JIM on JIRA 7.1.0-OD-02-025

My csv looks like


{noformat}
Summary, Assignee, Reporter, Issue Type, Description, Comment, Comment
"Test issue 1", admin, admin, 1, "Issue Description 1" ,  "01/01/2012 10:10:00; admin; This is comment 1"
"Test issue 2", admin, admin, 1, "Issue Description 2" ,  "01/01/2012 10:10:00; admin; This is comment 2.1", "01/01/2012 10:12:00; admin; This is comment 2.2"
{noformat}

however the comments get created as JUST now instead of in 2012

I get a comment like

 !image-2015-12-31-11-41-31-202.png|thumbnail! 

I did not change the suggested JIM date formats at all and left them as 

dd/MMM/yy h:mm a

The suggested help text from JIM does NOT match the actual format

{quote}
To preserve the comment author/date use format. E.g. "05/05/2010 11:20:30; adam; This is a comment."

^ this is what JIM suggests when importing.  

I then changed the data to have the AM/PM indicator as suggested but it still does not work and I get the same result.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64808].
  {panel}

When import a csv without specifying the priority to a project where the priority is optional, the default value is not auto added when the issue was created. 

However, in the documentation it was mentioned that the first priority will be used as the priority of created issue if not specified:

{quote} If not specified in your CSV file, imported issues will be given the default (i.e. first) Priority as specified in your JIRA system  Defining 'Priority' Field Values. You can also create new JIRA values on-the-fly during the import process.
{quote}

Furthermore, it doesn't throw any exception or add the default value even and JIRA is not really to handle null priorities.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a project
# Change its field configurations so 'priority' is optional
# Use CSV import to import a file where priority is not set

h2. Expected behavior
# Issues are imported and priority is set as default

h2. Actual behavior
# Issues are imported without priority

h2. Workaround:
*Workaround 1*
Search those issues that without priority and bulk edit them so that they will have priority.

*Workaround 2*
Change the field configuration in your project to have 'priority' as required before importing. You can change it back after the import.
fields.summary: Default priority value not added when it's not present in the csv file

h5. Summary:
Importing issues from CSV via Issue dropdown menu fails to create values in custom field the way it works when user uses "External CSV import" via Administrator Page.

*Affects JIRA*: 6.3.X

h5. How to replicate:
# Create a CSV with a few sample data(you can use the sample attached).
# Create the custom fields that were listed in the CSV in your JIRA instance. Do not enter any data especially in 'Select List field', 'Radio Button' (should not contain same data as one that is in CSV) and all other fields that require user to add their options on creation.
# In the CSV add a user that is the reporter but does not exist in JIRA.
# Import the CSV via the Issue Drop down menu by selecting: " Import Issues from CSV"
# Associate the fields with their respective equivalents from the CSV(Don't select any match data).
# Select Begin Import and you should get an error similar the the one below:
!CSV Import Error.PNG|thumbnail!

If however you use the external CSV import, the issue would not occur because the fields will be created.

h4. +Scenario+
If a Redmine issue is Resolved and has a Resolution (custom field in Redmine), when it's imported into JIRA, JIRA will both:
# map this Resolution field to a custom field in JIRA
(i) it's not possible to map to the Resolution system field in JIRA as per JIM-1247
# automatically add a new option for the Resolution system field in JIRA and make it available to the imported issue

(x) The consequence is the imported issue has 2 Resolution fields holding different values

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# in Redmine, create a custom field named Resolution
# open one Redmine issue and set the value of the Resolution field to Fixed, for example
# during Redmine import in JIRA, map this field to a custom field called Resolution in JIRA

h4. +Behaviors+
* (/) The Resolution custom field holds a Fixed value as per JIM-876
* (x) JIRA however interprets the Resolution value from Redmine incorrectly as *1* during the import:
!incorrectvalue.png|thumbnail!
* (x) This value is then created as an option for the Resolution system field:
!resolutionoption.png|thumbnail!
* (x) The imported issue then has 2 Resolutions:
!tworesolution.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Notes+
If it's possible to map a Redmine custom field to the Resolution system field in JIRA, this issue shouldn't happen. Implementing JIM-1247 should take this issue into account
fields.summary: Strange behavior of mapping a Resolution field when importing from Redmine

h3. Summary

When exporting certain projects to JSON with the beta JSON exporter function of JIM, 403 - Forbidden errors are encountered in the browser. Pleas see screenshot of Dev Tools console in Chrome. No logs are written in the JIRA logs.

h3. Environment
* This is the most up to date JIRA Cloud environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for issues with the filter only filtering one specific project
# Export to JSON.
# Some projects will work, some will not. It appears to be random from the user's perspective.

h3. Expected Results

Should export to JSON.

h3. Actual Results

403 error is thrown in the browser. This has been tested on multiple browsers.
 
h3.Workaround

None at this time.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64768].
  {panel}

When importing a sub-task via CSV, you should require a reference to the parent issue.
If you try to import the CSV via _Issues > Import Issues from CSV_, that validation is done, however when importing through _Administration > System > External System Import_ the CSV import creates orphan sub-tasks.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a CSV with only a sub-task to be created, with no parent issue specified
# Import CSV using External System Import

*Expected Behaviour*
A warning message saying "Subtask 'Issue' doesn't have a valid Parent Id selection. Issue will not be created." should be displayed (as it is on "Import Issues from CSV")

*Actual behaviour*
Issue is created successfully without a parent
fields.summary: CSV import allow orphan sub-task via External System Import

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64758].
  {panel}

A bug is happening on import of projects from Bitbucket to JIRA. When issues are imported to a JIRA project, their issue types are requested, as the image below shows:
!mapping_importing_issues_bitbucket_jira.png!

The available issue types are not the ones in the project’s ‘Issue Type Scheme’ and when selected an issue type that is not one of the types available for the project, an error occurs.
This is the error
!error_importing_bitbucket.png!
It reads ‘Error importing issue ExternalIssue{externalId=1, summary=Test issue, issueType=1}’

When checking the logs, the follow stacktrace is present for the error:
{noformat}
ERROR - Error importing issue ExternalIssue{externalId=2, summary=Mode command text moves when mouse is held down, issueType=1}
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.external.ExternalException: Unable to create or update issue: ExternalIssue{externalId=2, summary=Mode command text moves when mouse is held down, issueType=1}
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.createIssue(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:903)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:764)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:390)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:58)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:56)
...
{noformat}

*Steps to reproduce*
* Create a project in JIRA that does not contain all issue types
* Create a project in BitBucket and create issues
* Import the project in Bitbucket to the project in JIRA
* Map some issue types (with existent issues in BitBucket) in the project to types that are not mapped to the project
* Begin import
* The error will occur

*Workarounds*
* Check carefully the types to make sure no type is mapped to unmapped types in the project

When I import an CVS file to create issues on Jira Cloud (Menu: Issues < Import Issues from CSV) the Original estimete time set on the sheet is rounded into jira cloud.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64747].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
CSV importer doesn't import *Select List (cascading)* field data correctly.
This problem happens only when we use {{Issues}} > {{Import Issues from CSV}} on the top page.
This problem never happens when we import CSV with using {{System}} > {{External System Import}} in Administration page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# Add *Select List (cascading)* custom field and set their options
# Associate the custom field to the project you created on step1
# Import CSV (See example file) from {{Issues}} > {{Import Issues from CSV}}

h3. Expected Results
The CSV data should be imported to JIRA correctly.

h3. Actual Results
*Select List (cascading)* custom field data (especially the child option) wasn't imported. (See following screenshot)
!cascading.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Use {{System}} > {{External System Import}} in Administration page instead.

The Bugzilla Import using the JIM documentation currently states the following about Bugzilla version support, which is misleading to customers:
bq. Version 4.1 or later of the JIRA Importers plugin is compatible with Bugzilla 2.20 to 4.0.2.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64730].
  {panel}

Importing a Remaining Estimate using a CSV shows as a change in the issue history. The change in issue history shows that both the Remaining Estimate and the Original Estimate have changed
 * New Value for both = Remaining Estimate imported from CSV

The field values shows correct. The Original Estimate continues to show the value prior to the import. The Remaining Estimate shows the value imported.
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 * Create issue with Original Estimate and different Remaining Estimate
 * Export to CSV
 * Change Remaining Estimate in CSV
 * Import from CSV choosing Summary, Issue Key, Remaining Estimate.
 * Review the history and estimate field values on the issue

h3. Expected Behavior

Change History shows that Remaining Estimate changed without showing any change to Original Estimate
fields.summary: CSV import of Remaining Estimate overwrites Original Estimate in issue history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64724].
  {panel}

h3. Environment
JIRA BTF 6.4.2 and JIM 6.3.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Go to *External System Import* screen in JIRA
Choose to import data from *Pivotal Tracker*
Proceed with the steps to complete the import process


h3. Expected Results
All the data is imported in JIRA and new fields are created in the target project if necessary


h3. Actual Results
All the data is created, but is also created a *External issue ID* and *External issue URL* custom fields for each import attempt. If the customer choose to import one project each time instead of importing all the projects together, JIRA will have lots of these fields at the end of the process.

Would be better if JIM could use the same custom field already created in the first import process instead of created a new one for each import.
fields.summary: Import data from Pivotal will create a External Issue url and External issue id for each import
Comment author is forced to the importing admin when missing or invalid

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64720].
  {panel}

PreConditions:
Set the attachment size limit to 5kb in JIRA

Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch github importer.
2. Try importing issues which has attachments which are more than 5kb.

Expected Behavior:
Importer must respect the attachment limit set by the JIRA.

Actual Behavior:
Importer imports the attachments without respecting the limit set by the JIRA.
fields.summary: Github importer allows users to import attachment which exceed the limit set in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64718].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When using the CSV Importer if no email domain is specified when creating users then all users are created with the typo'd domain 'noreplay@example.com'.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create CSV file that has some usernames for users that don't exist in your JIRA instance.
# Import the above CSV file through the CSV importer.
# When configuring the importer don't specify any email domain, and just select the assignee and summary to import the issues.

h3. Expected Results

Users are created with the email address 'noreply@example.com'

h3. Actual Results

Users are actually created with 'noreplay@example.com'
 
h3.Workaround

Specify an email domain so that users are created with a more valid email address.
fields.summary: If no email domain is specified in the importer users are created with the typo'd email address 'noreplay@example.com'
